intro: Haplopappus maulinus, commonly known as the Sierra Nevada pappus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in mountainous regions, showcasing adaptations to arid and high-altitude environments. Its structure includes a basal rosette of leaves and a slender stem topped with a single capitulum. Haplopappus maulinus plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and nectar for pollinators.
